Browse the source code of netbsd/external/ibm-public/postfix/dist/src/util/dict_utf8.c

1/* $NetBSD: dict_utf8.c,v 1.2 2017/02/14 01:16:49 christos Exp $ */
2
3/*++
4/* NAME
5/* dict_utf8 3
6/* SUMMARY
7/* dictionary UTF-8 helpers
8/* SYNOPSIS
9/* #include <dict.h>
10/*
11/* DICT *dict_utf8_activate(
12/* DICT *dict)
13/* DESCRIPTION
14/* dict_utf8_activate() wraps a dictionary's lookup/update/delete
15/* methods with code that enforces UTF-8 checks on keys and
16/* values, and that logs a warning when incorrect UTF-8 is
17/* encountered. The original dictionary handle becomes invalid.
18/*
19/* The wrapper code enforces a policy that maximizes application
20/* robustness (it avoids the need for new error-handling code
21/* paths in application code). Attempts to store non-UTF-8
22/* keys or values are skipped while reporting a non-error
23/* status, attempts to look up or delete non-UTF-8 keys are
24/* skipped while reporting a non-error status, and lookup
25/* results that contain a non-UTF-8 value are blocked while
26/* reporting a configuration error.
27/* BUGS
28/* dict_utf8_activate() does not nest.
29/* LICENSE
30/* .ad
31/* .fi
32/* The Secure Mailer license must be distributed with this software.
33/* AUTHOR(S)
34/* Wietse Venema
35/* IBM T.J. Watson Research
36/* P.O. Box 704
37/* Yorktown Heights, NY 10598, USA
38/*--*/
39
40 /*
41 * System library.
42 */
43#include <sys_defs.h>
44#include <string.h>
45
46 /*
47 * Utility library.
48 */
49#include <msg.h>
50#include <stringops.h>
51#include <dict.h>
52#include <mymalloc.h>
53#include <msg.h>
54
55 /*
56 * The goal is to maximize robustness: bad UTF-8 should not appear in keys,
57 * because those are derived from controlled inputs, and values should be
58 * printable before they are stored. But if we failed to check something
59 * then it should not result in fatal errors and thus open up the system for
60 * a denial-of-service attack.
61 *
62 * Proposed over-all policy: skip attempts to store invalid UTF-8 lookup keys
63 * or values. Rationale: some storage may not permit malformed UTF-8. This
64 * maximizes program robustness. If we get an invalid lookup result, report
65 * a configuration error.
66 *
67 * LOOKUP
68 *
69 * If the key is invalid, log a warning and skip the request. Rationale: the
70 * item cannot exist.
71 *
72 * If the lookup result is invalid, log a warning and return a configuration
73 * error.
74 *
75 * UPDATE
76 *
77 * If the key is invalid, then log a warning and skip the request. Rationale:
78 * the item cannot exist.
79 *
80 * If the value is invalid, log a warning and skip the request. Rationale:
81 * storage may not permit malformed UTF-8. This maximizes program
82 * robustness.
83 *
84 * DELETE
85 *
86 * If the key is invalid, then skip the request. Rationale: the item cannot
87 * exist.
88 */
89
90/* dict_utf8_check_fold - casefold or validate string */
91
92static char *dict_utf8_check_fold(DICT *dict, const char *string,
93 CONST_CHAR_STAR *err)
94{
95 int fold_flag = (dict->flags & DICT_FLAG_FOLD_ANY);
96
97 /*
98 * Validate UTF-8 without casefolding.
99 */
100 if (!allascii(string) && valid_utf8_string(string, strlen(string)) == 0) {
101 if (err)
102 *err = "malformed UTF-8 or invalid codepoint";
103 return (0);
104 }
105
106 /*
107 * Casefold UTF-8.
108 */
109 if (fold_flag != 0 && (fold_flag & (dict->flags & DICT_FLAG_FIXED) ?
110 DICT_FLAG_FOLD_FIX : DICT_FLAG_FOLD_MUL)) {
111 if (dict->fold_buf == 0)
112 dict->fold_buf = vstring_alloc(10);
113 return (casefold(dict->fold_buf, string));
114 }
115 return ((char *) string);
116}
117
118/* dict_utf8_check validate UTF-8 string */
119
120static int dict_utf8_check(const char *string, CONST_CHAR_STAR *err)
121{
122 if (!allascii(string) && valid_utf8_string(string, strlen(string)) == 0) {
123 if (err)
124 *err = "malformed UTF-8 or invalid codepoint";
125 return (0);
126 }
127 return (1);
128}
129
130/* dict_utf8_lookup - UTF-8 lookup method wrapper */
131
132static const char *dict_utf8_lookup(DICT *dict, const char *key)
133{
134 DICT_UTF8_BACKUP *backup;
135 const char *utf8_err;
136 const char *fold_res;
137 const char *value;
138 int saved_flags;
139
140 /*
141 * Validate and optionally fold the key, and if invalid skip the request.
142 */
143 if ((fold_res = dict_utf8_check_fold(dict, key, &utf8_err)) == 0) {
144 msg_warn("%s:%s: non-UTF-8 key \"%s\": %s",
145 dict->type, dict->name, key, utf8_err);
146 dict->error = DICT_ERR_NONE;
147 return (0);
148 }
149
150 /*
151 * Proxy the request with casefolding turned off.
152 */
153 saved_flags = (dict->flags & DICT_FLAG_FOLD_ANY);
154 dict->flags &= ~DICT_FLAG_FOLD_ANY;
155 backup = dict->utf8_backup;
156 value = backup->lookup(dict, fold_res);
157 dict->flags |= saved_flags;
158
159 /*
160 * Validate the result, and if invalid fail the request.
161 */
162 if (value != 0 && dict_utf8_check(value, &utf8_err) == 0) {
163 msg_warn("%s:%s: key \"%s\": non-UTF-8 value \"%s\": %s",
164 dict->type, dict->name, key, value, utf8_err);
165 dict->error = DICT_ERR_CONFIG;
166 return (0);
167 } else {
168 return (value);
169 }
170}
171
172/* dict_utf8_update - UTF-8 update method wrapper */
173
174static int dict_utf8_update(DICT *dict, const char *key, const char *value)
175{
176 DICT_UTF8_BACKUP *backup;
177 const char *utf8_err;
178 const char *fold_res;
179 int saved_flags;
180 int status;
181
182 /*
183 * Validate or fold the key, and if invalid skip the request.
184 */
185 if ((fold_res = dict_utf8_check_fold(dict, key, &utf8_err)) == 0) {
186 msg_warn("%s:%s: non-UTF-8 key \"%s\": %s",
187 dict->type, dict->name, key, utf8_err);
188 dict->error = DICT_ERR_NONE;
189 return (DICT_STAT_SUCCESS);
190 }
191
192 /*
193 * Validate the value, and if invalid skip the request.
194 */
195 else if (dict_utf8_check(value, &utf8_err) == 0) {
196 msg_warn("%s:%s: key \"%s\": non-UTF-8 value \"%s\": %s",
197 dict->type, dict->name, key, value, utf8_err);
198 dict->error = DICT_ERR_NONE;
199 return (DICT_STAT_SUCCESS);
200 }
201
202 /*
203 * Proxy the request with casefolding turned off.
204 */
205 else {
206 saved_flags = (dict->flags & DICT_FLAG_FOLD_ANY);
207 dict->flags &= ~DICT_FLAG_FOLD_ANY;
208 backup = dict->utf8_backup;
209 status = backup->update(dict, fold_res, value);
210 dict->flags |= saved_flags;
211 return (status);
212 }
213}
214
215/* dict_utf8_delete - UTF-8 delete method wrapper */
216
217static int dict_utf8_delete(DICT *dict, const char *key)
218{
219 DICT_UTF8_BACKUP *backup;
220 const char *utf8_err;
221 const char *fold_res;
222 int saved_flags;
223 int status;
224
225 /*
226 * Validate and optionally fold the key, and if invalid skip the request.
227 */
228 if ((fold_res = dict_utf8_check_fold(dict, key, &utf8_err)) == 0) {
229 msg_warn("%s:%s: non-UTF-8 key \"%s\": %s",
230 dict->type, dict->name, key, utf8_err);
231 dict->error = DICT_ERR_NONE;
232 return (DICT_STAT_SUCCESS);
233 }
234
235 /*
236 * Proxy the request with casefolding turned off.
237 */
238 else {
239 saved_flags = (dict->flags & DICT_FLAG_FOLD_ANY);
240 dict->flags &= ~DICT_FLAG_FOLD_ANY;
241 backup = dict->utf8_backup;
242 status = backup->delete(dict, fold_res);
243 dict->flags |= saved_flags;
244 return (status);
245 }
246}
247
248/* dict_utf8_activate - wrap a legacy dict object for UTF-8 processing */
249
250DICT *dict_utf8_activate(DICT *dict)
251{
252 const char myname[] = "dict_utf8_activate";
253 DICT_UTF8_BACKUP *backup;
254
255 /*
256 * Sanity check.
257 */
258 if (util_utf8_enable == 0)
259 msg_panic("%s: Unicode support is not available", myname);
260 if ((dict->flags & DICT_FLAG_UTF8_REQUEST) == 0)
261 msg_panic("%s: %s:%s does not request Unicode support",
262 myname, dict->type, dict->name);
263 if ((dict->flags & DICT_FLAG_UTF8_ACTIVE) || dict->utf8_backup != 0)
264 msg_panic("%s: %s:%s Unicode support is already activated",
265 myname, dict->type, dict->name);
266
267 /*
268 * Unlike dict_debug(3) we do not put a proxy dict object in front of the
269 * encapsulated object, because then we would have to bidirectionally
270 * propagate changes in the data members (errors, flags, jbuf, and so on)
271 * between proxy object and encapsulated object.
272 *
273 * Instead we attach ourselves behind the encapsulated dict object, and
274 * redirect some function pointers to ourselves.
275 */
276 backup = dict->utf8_backup = (DICT_UTF8_BACKUP *) mymalloc(sizeof(*backup));
277
278 /*
279 * Interpose on the lookup/update/delete methods. It is a conscious
280 * decision not to tinker with the iterator or destructor.
281 */
282 backup->lookup = dict->lookup;
283 backup->update = dict->update;
284 backup->delete = dict->delete;
285
286 dict->lookup = dict_utf8_lookup;
287 dict->update = dict_utf8_update;
288 dict->delete = dict_utf8_delete;
289
290 /*
291 * Leave our mark. See sanity check above.
292 */
293 dict->flags |= DICT_FLAG_UTF8_ACTIVE;
294
295 return (dict);
296}
